content: Principles of Health Interoperability: #SNOMED CT, #HL7 and #FHIR now on amazon: amzn.to/1tyYQPt - prerelease for availability June 30
I hope you will be autographing them at the next WGM!
Sweet, congrats!! I see 2nd edition in iBooks, so assuming your contributions will find their way there as well?
no. this is the 3rd edition - update that replaces the 2nd edition, but you know better than to expect a free update!
Josh, sure, I'll sign any at the next WGM
Ha, I didn't mean a free upgrade, just whether it'll be available via iBooks at one point as well. :)
I hope so, but I don't know
If that's not already assigned reading for my Interoperability class this Autumn, I'm going to add it to my reading list! Any chance it has info on open-source SNOMED CT implementations?
I don't think there are many... except for mine.

Next version of HAPI will support importing SCT into its terminology services for searching, expanding, etc... It's not a complete implementation (for now it only understands is-a relationships, doesn't store synonyms, etc) but that'll hopefully come with time
I don't think that Grahame will be digitally signing the ebooks @Michael Lawley ;)

@Abigail Watson not open source (sorry), but an openly acessible implementation of FHIR Terminology Services at http://ontoserver.csiro.au/stu3 that you/your class can use - very complete SNOMED CT support including multiple versions and extensions

@Michael Lawley, I notice that ontoserver is still supporting the syntax for properties on the CodeSystem $lookup operation that's in the current build spec &properties=code,display,designations, rather than the one that you thought was correct in Montreal &property=code&property=display&property=designations Has there been a change of mind on this?

@Peter Jordan Are you using the latest STU3 Ontoserver? http://ontoserver.csiro.au/stu3/CodeSystem/$lookup?system=http://snomed.info/sct&code=45313011000036107&property=inactive&version=http://snomed.info/sct/32506021000036107/version/20160531&property=display
